name: Common
speakers: Humans, Dwarves, Elves, Halflings, and other common ancestries
description: Common is a relative term used to denote the most prevalent human language spoken in a particular region. In each different region there may be different dialects and variations in the common language. In general, Common is the name for the standard language in which most humanoids speak.

name: Draconic
description: It is believed that Draconic is among the oldest, if not the oldest, language of the multiverse. Because of this, nearly all other languages can trace some roots back to this primordial tongue. Many reptilian races use crude versions of Draconic, including kobolds, lizardfolk, and troglodytes, and present this as proof of their kinship with dragons. It is equally likely that these races were once taught or enslaved by dragons, and it is even possible that they took Draconic for their own simply to make a claim to common ancestors.

name: Dwarven
description: Dwarven is a clipped language of hard consonants and guttural pronunciation. Dwarven shares its runic alphabet with Terran, along with a number of other similarities. Dwarven names are full of harsh-sounding consonants, and rarely include soft, or sibilant sounds. Honorifics are common in given names, such as "-sun" ("-son"), "-dam" ("-daughter"), and "-hild" ("-wife"). Family names sometimes contain words in (language: Common) such as "gold" or "hammer". Also, the letters Q and X do not appear in Dwarven.

name: Elven
description: Elven is believed to be among the eldest, if not the eldest of the languages mortals speak. Scholars conjecture that it was formed when elven speakers of [Fey](link_language_90) tried to introduce grammatical rules and vocabulary from both [Empyrean](link_language_307) and [Draconic](link_language_82). The elven alphabet contains thirty-three letters (twenty-four consonants and nine vowels). It is a complex language, but sounds poetic in tone and cadence.

name: Goblin
description: Goblin vocabulary is shared by the goblin, bugbear, and hobgoblin races, even if the pronunciations, inflections, and usage differs wildly among them. When spoken by goblins, it is nearly incomprehensible to outsiders, and sounds more like high-pitched yapping. Among the martial hobgoblins, it takes the form of short, barked commands, while the bugbears speak their taunts with a sibilance not heard among the other goblinoid races. It is an extremely flexible language, containing a plethora of terms related to subservience, fear, and death.

name: Halfling
description: Halfling, which was properly called Luiric, was a language spoken by the halflings of Luiren. Since halflings were so adaptive by nature, the vast majority of halflings outside of Luiren had abandoned their native tongue and spoke [Common](link_language_81) or other human languages instead.

name: Jotun
description: The language of the various races of giants that exist today. It was first used by the giant slaves of the runelords in the ages long ago.

name: Orcish
description: Much like the folk who speak it, Orcish is a harsh and violent language, full of sharp delivery and hard consonants.

name: Wildsong
description: The Wildsong is a melodic and tonal language sounding more like animal calls than a spoken tongue, and its alphabet involves fractals and spirals, like the arrangement of a seashell’s chambers, a snowflake’s crystals, or a fern’s fronds. Teaching the Wildsong to non-druids is anathema.

name: Gnomish
description: In terms of the sheer number of words in its vocabulary, Gnome, or Gnomish, is the largest language known. It has changed dramatically since gnomes first introduced it to the world, a process which has by no means halted. It shares certain similarities with both [Aklo](link_language_93) and [Fey](link_language_90).

name: Hallit
speakers: Broken Lands, Eye of Dread, Saga Lands

name: Muan
description: Ardande Gardener, Faydhaan Shuyookh, Gennayn, Harvest Regiment, Jann Shuyookh, Kizidhar, Kizidhar Shuyookh, Living Grove, Lomori Sprout, Nightwood Guardian, Snapdrake, Twins of Rowan, Whipping Willow, Wood Scamp, Wood Wisp

name: Ratajin
description: Ratajin Masterminds are speakers of Ratajin.

name: Grippli
description: The grippli language is composed of croaks, groans, clicks, and squeaks. Their croaking voices make them hard to comprehend in any language other than their own. Other ancestries can learn Grippli, but cannot truly master it without magic. Writing is taboo to the grippli; only the tribe mother is permitted to make written records. Grippli has no written form, but the mother can read and write in Sakvroth.

name: Azlanti
description: Language spoken in the High Seas region.

name: Thassilonian
description: Modern Giant, Varisian, and Shoanti contain elements of this truly ancient language spoken in the Thassilonian Empire before the coming of the Age of Darkness. Scholars remember it chiefly as the first language to develop three grammatical genders and for using a complex alphabet made up of three separate runic systems based heavily on Azlanti. Once considered a dead language, the Thassilonian city of Xin-Edasseril was recently freed from temporal stasis, resulting in the first living population of Thassilonian speakers in nearly 10,000 years.

name: Surki
description: The language spoken by Surkis, an insectile species who subsist on the latent magic in the world around them.

name: D'Ziriak
description: The D'ziriak language is a mix of buzzes and chitters, and is spoken by few other creatures.

name: Kasatha
speakers: Kasathas, inhabitants of the Idari or Kasath

name: Brethedan
speakers: Inhabitants of Bretheda (barathu), Liavara, and their moons

name: Vesk (Regional)
speakers: Inhabitants of Pulonis (pahtra) and the Veskarium (vesk)

name: Azlanti (Playtest)
speakers: Inhabitants of the Azlanti Star Empire (azlanti)

name: Common (Playtest)
speakers: Humans, most citizens of the Pact Worlds

name: Morandomandranan
description: The original [skittermander](link_ancestry_211) language which has long been suppressed by the Veskarium.

name: Morandomandranan
description: The original skittermander language that has long been suppressed by the Veskarium.

name: Brethedan
speakers: Bretheda, Liavara, and their moons (barathus, kalos, maraquoi)

name: Kasatha
speakers: Kasathas, inhabitants of Kasath or the Idari

name: Common
speakers: Humans, most citizens of the Pact Worlds
